Petani Tembakau Ngobrol 2 Jam Bareng Dirjen Bea dan Cukai, Hasilnya?
04 Nov 2019, 06:46 by Vadhia Lidyana


Foto: Demo Petani Tembakau di Depan Kementerian Keuangan, (Vadhia Lidyana/detikFinance)

Jakarta - Asosiasi Petani Tembakau Indonesia (APTI) Jawa Barat (Jabar) hari ini menggelar unjuk rasa di depan kantor Kementerian Keuangan, di kawasan Lapangan Banteng, Jakarta Pusat. Belum sampai 1 jam mereka berdemo, 12 orang perwakilan APTI Jabar dipanggil untuk menemui Direktur Jenderal (Dirjen) Bea dan Cukai Kemenkeu, Heru Pambudi untuk menyampaikan aspirasinya.Pertemuan yang berlangsung hampir dua jam tersebut menghasilkan kesepakatan antara pemerintah dengan APTI Jabar. "Mereka APTI sampaikan aspirasi, mereka adalah APTI, yang pertama adalah mereka ingin produk tembakau bisa diserap oleh pabrikan, kedua mereka berharap mereka juga bisa dapatkan porsi dari dana bagi hasil (DBH) cukai hasil tembakau (CHT) yang selama ini sudah dideliver oleh masing-masing daerah sesuai dengan peruntukannya," kata Heru di kantor Kemenkeu, Jakarta, Senin (4/11/2019).Mengenai tuntutan APTI soal serapan tembakau petani, Heru mengatakan bahwa pemerintah akan berupaya meningkatkan serapan hasil tembakau petani rakyat. Dalam hal ini, serbuan impor hasil tembakau juga akan dikendalikan pemerintah, sehingga serapan hasil tembakau petani meningkat."APTI ini concern dengan serapan. Dan pemerintah sebenarnya sudah merespon dari rapat-rapat teknis yang insyaallah dari 1-2 pertemuan ini akan selesai. Dan pemerintah sesuai arahah Presiden akan memperhatikan petani melalui serapan produksi. Yang kedua tentunya ini bisa dikaitkan dengan volume impor. Kita akan mengatur volume impor dan memastikan produksi petani bisa diserap," ungkap Heru.Dalam mengatur volume impor tembakau ini, Heru mengatakan pihaknya perlu berkoordinasi dengan kementerian/lembaga (K/L) terkait."Ini akan kita atur melalui formula yang terintegrasi antara K/L. Karena ada kepentingan petani, industri, dan juga perdagangan," ujar dia.Selanjutnya, mengenai DBH CHT yang diatur dalam PMK 222 tahun 2017, Heru mengungkapkan pihaknya akan merilis PMK baru, yaitu PMK 139 tahun 2020. Dalam PMK 139 tersebut, formulasi DBH CHT akan berbeda dan Pemerintah Pusat akan mengawasi Pemerintah Daerah (Pemda) dalam mengatur DBH CHT."Yang kedua terkait dengan aspirasi untuk mendapatkan porsi yang proporsional dari dana bagi hasil cukai tembakau maka sebenarnya pemerintah melalui PMK 139 yang berlaku tahun depan itu sudah memodifikasi formulanya. Dan yang sebelumnya menyerahkan sepenuhnya kepada Pemda, jadi nanti akan mulai ada penilaian-penilaian dari kementerian terkait tentang peruntukkan DBH itu," jelas Heru.Ketiga, mengenai kenaikan cukai rokok dan harga eceran tertinggi (HJE), menurut Heru, kenaikan tersebut variatif dan disesuaikan dengan golongan rokok. Heru menjelaskan, untuk Sigaret Kretek Tangan (SKT) mengalami kenaikan terendah karena pemerintah memperhatikan tenaga kerja dari industri padat karya tersebut."Kalau kita perhatikan PMK 152 itu meskipun average-nya adalah 23% dan 35%, tapi kalau kita lihat detailnya itu variatif. Pemerintah betul-betul telah memperhatikan kemampuan antar golongan, kemampuan antar jenis rokok. Sehingga kenaikan cukai rokok jenis SKT start-nya dari 12%. Itu membuktikan bahwa pemerintah memperhatikan tenaga kerja yang di industri padat karya, makanya kenaikan tarif SKT itu terendah," papar Heru. Tobacco Farmers Chat for 2 Hours Together with the Director General of Customs and Excise, the Results?
04 Nov 2019, 06:46 by Vadhia Lidyana


Photo: Tobacco Farmers Demo in Front of the Ministry of Finance, (Vadhia Lidyana / detikFinance)

Jakarta - The Indonesian Tobacco Farmers Association (APTI) West Java (West Java) today held a rally in front of the Ministry of Finance's office, in the Banteng Field area, Central Jakarta. In less than an hour of their demonstration, 12 representatives of the West Java APTI were summoned to meet with the Ministry of Finance Customs and Excise Director General, Heru Pambudi, to convey their aspirations. The meeting which lasted for almost two hours resulted in an agreement between the government and APTI West Java. "They APTI convey their aspirations, they are APTI, the first is they want tobacco products to be absorbed by the manufacturer, secondly they hope they can also get a portion of the tobacco excise (DBH) revenue sharing fund (CHT) which has been delivered by each -e region in accordance with its designation, "Heru said at the Ministry of Finance office, Jakarta, Monday (11/04/2019). Regarding the demands of APTI regarding tobacco uptake of farmers, Heru said that the government would try to increase the uptake of smallholder tobacco products. In this case, the invasion of imported tobacco products will also be controlled by the government, so that farmers' tobacco product uptake will increase. "APTI is concerned with uptake. And the government has actually responded from technical meetings that God willing from these 1-2 meetings will be completed. And the government according to the direction the President will pay attention to farmers through production uptake. The second of course this can be related to the volume of imports. We will regulate the volume of imports and ensure farmers' production can be absorbed, "said Heru. In regulating the volume of tobacco imports, Heru said it needed to coordinate with the ministry / related institutions (K / L). "We will arrange this through an integrated formula between K / L. Because there are interests of farmers, industry, and also trade," he said. Furthermore, regarding the DBH CHT which is regulated in PMK 222 of 2017 Heru revealed that his party would release a new PMK, namely PMK 139 in 2020. In the PMK 139, the formulation of DBH CHT would be different and the Government h The center will oversee the Regional Government (Pemda) in regulating the DBH CHT. "The second is related to the aspirations to get a proportionate portion of the tobacco excise revenue sharing fund, so actually the government through PMK 139 which applies next year has modified the formula. And who previously submitted it entirely to the Regional Government, so later there will start assessments from the relevant ministries about the designation of the DBH, "explained Heru. Third, regarding the increase in cigarette excise tax and the highest retail price (HJE), according to Heru, the increase was varied and adjusted with the cigarette group, Heru explained, for Hand Clove Cigarette (SKT) experienced the lowest increase because the government paid attention to labor from the labor-intensive industry. "If we pay attention to PMK 152 even though the average is 23% and 35%, but if we look the details are varied. The government has really paid attention to the ability between groups, the ability between types of cigarettes. So that the increase in excise tax on types of SKT starts from 12%. It proves that the government pays attention to workers in labor-intensive industries, so the lowest SKT tariff increase, "said Heru.
